Description: This official statistics report provides the findings from the Mental Capacity Act 2005, Deprivation of Liberty Safeguards (DoLS) data collection for the period 1 April 2017 to 31 March 2018. DoLS are a legal framework that exist to ensure that individuals who lack the mental capacity to consent to the arrangements for their care, where such care may amount to a deprivation of liberty, have the arrangements independently assessed to ensure they are in the best interests of the individual concerned.
Name: Mental Capacity Act 2005, Deprivation of Liberty Safeguards
Notes: NHS site detailing Mental Capacity Act 2005, Deprivation of Liberty Safeguards (DoLS) data. Individuals who lack the mental capacity to consent to the arrangements for their care amounts to a deprivation of liberty, have the arrangements independently assessed. Obviously this info would fall under COGS disability data interest. Various data links that would require discussion.
Route from landing page to data: Data on this page identified via a link at top of page under heading Summary then Latest version. This will link to another page with the latest data, identified on page under heading Resources as a series of tables in XLS and CSV format.
Sizing Notes: Multiple tables spread across several files. Simple table structures but variations of structures and with multiple dimensions/ subdimensions and footnotes.
